reviewText:
I don’t normally write reviews but I felt I had to contribute due to the increase of negative responses, which does not justify this visual novel.

Cupid follows a nameless female orphan set in the 18th century of France, guided by her mother’s voice who you will play the role of (by selecting choices that pops up once in awhile). She becomes entangled into the affairs of her best friend, Catherine, and her betrothed, Guilleme.

The main theme in this story is love - the good and the bad kind.

It is an extremely well-written visual novel, the pace is just about right, with beautiful artwork and sound-effects to accompany this. It is not your typical visual novel, it has very dark mature content (think psychological horror), so it can become quite complex and disturbing, but I LOVE that!

As this is a free visual novel and it delves into controversial topics, I can see people trying this out and well… not liking it. So I would not recommend this if you do not like dark disturbing content, or reading visual novels, neither would I recommend this as a first visual novel.

However I highly recommend this if you like psychological horror, the twisted kind.

reviewText:
When a friend of mine posted her screenshots of this visual novel, I was both intrigued and slightly disturbed at the same time. I would walk away from my computer, but those images would stay in my mind. I never thought I would play something like this, but you know what they say...

So once the kiddos were safely put to bed, I played it, prepared for a really sordid, disturbing, gratuitous time....and actually got something quite different.

Nothing in this visual novel is gratuitous. This visual novel really is a dark fairy tale at heart, taking its inspiration from Greek/Roman mythology, which can also be pretty twisted if you read it. The story itself (I really don't want to spoil too much, since you get enough of a hint from the store page.) is dark, sensual, and passionate. However it can also be endearing, touching, and lighthearted. The tricky thing is that this visual novel can change tones in a heart beat, so when it goes from light to dark or disturbing, it can be really startling. I know I jumped a few times, because there is no warning. There are many many achievements because there are so many ways that this story can be played. The game is only as twisted as you want it to be. The first time I played, my character had a good motivation, and the mother was not as abusive as she could be, but understanding and ultimately fueled by a parent's love. As a mother, I couldn't help but insert myself in the mother's role and try to pick the best responses. When you go down that path, you reach the happiest and least sordid of endings. But then I got curious...and I discovered that the more dark you want the game to be, the story will match how far you want to go....and it can go a LONG way downhill. Far worse than the sexual content of this game (since most of it is read anyway) are the themes of child abuse and verbal abuse.

Now the look of the game is beautiful. I love the Victorian time period, and the colors are just gorgeous. I loved the fashion and the beautiful places you get to go to. The game features some disturbing visuals as well, but they are done in a way that you can't really look away. I've never played any other visual novels except The 39 Steps, so for a Free to Play, I would say this is very very good work.

The soundtrack is gorgeous. It fits the time period perfectly, and also includes classical music when appropriate to the story. The sound effects build tension in the game when necessary, whether its fear, anxiety, insanity, or sexual tension.

Now some cool extras. I've already mentioned the many achievements and the multiple endings, but there is more! There are extras that tell you about the inspiration of the story, how the game was made, and the road that was taken to make the game a reality. The more achievements you get, the more you unlock, rewarding you with entertaining and hilarious extras! I really enjoyed learning about the creative process since it helps you appreciate the story more.

So in the end, I am really glad that I played/read it. I would hope that my review would answer questions or relieve any doubts for other players who are kind of on the fence about titles like this. This visual novel poses interesting questions on the nature of love, and its many faces and disguises. It also takes an interesting look at the question of loving someone and acting out of fear. For a Free to Play, this has a whole lot to offer.

reviewText:
Cupid is easily one of the best visual novels I've ever played. It also happens to be an OELVN, so it proves that occidental visual novels have nothing to envy to Japanese ones. The attention to details and work put into it are not what you would expect from a non commercial one.

The peculiarity in this visual novel is that the player has to play as a third person point of view character — that of Mother. Whether you'll find yourself trying to manipulate or consoling, know that your choices only end up affecting the main character's actions and not completely controlling them.

As the plot takes form, you start to notice that the story is all centered around the theme of love, but not in the traditional 'romance' sense. All its good and bad qualities are present. Be they an obsessive, abusive, twisted love, or storge, love between friends, carnal love.

The story has a nonlinear narrative, events are portrayed out of chronological order. It also sometimes changes perspective from one character to the other, so that the player gets to see other sides to the story.

The artwork is well done, the character sprites have several expressions. Some CGs have a variant for who enables the mature filter content. I wished that the menu had a larger and more visible font.
I loved the music. There are famous pieces (Bach, Rachmaninoff, etc.) next to original ones that I found haunting and difficult to forget (in a good way!).
I found myself surprised in front of details such as the sound effects that were so spot-on with the scenes.

There are four endings and one secret bonus ending that you can get when you unlock all the previous ones.

I'd like to state that maybe you should step back from this game if you think that its dark themes might be too much for you. List of trigger warnings under spoiler: mentions of 'physical abuse', verbal abuse, gore, vomit, suggested eye trauma, parental abuse, suggested parental incest

This visual novel contains the following adult subject matter, which could be triggering for some: nudity, incest, physical abuse, mental abuse, verbal abuse, physical assault, r/a/p/e, blood, murder, self-harm, suicide, and general depressing/disturbing scenes.

This story was not quite what I expected. It was a pleasant surprise, but I wasn't quite prepared for such a serious/depressing story. It definitely is worth money, so I'm not sure why it's free. In fact, it is one of the best visual novels I've read on Steam.

There are five different endings, including a secret ending. They range from disturbing to less disturbing. While I suppose there are good and bad endings, there aren't really happy endings. I suppose someone could interpret one of them as happy, but it wouldn't be in a conventional sense.

Honestly, trying to give a description of the story is difficult. It's quite abstract. The main theme is love; I guess you could say the dark side of love. The side of love that can drive a person insane over it. While some claim that love is the best feeling in the world, no one can deny that it is also tied to such feelings as pain, loneliness, and obsession.

I wouldn't recommend this visual novel to anyone who has strong feelings about the subjects listed above. It is very dark and disturbing. If you're used to lighthearted VNs, this probably isn't for you.

Cupid is a well-written, fantastic visual novel that has obviously had a lot of love and care put into it. To be honest I was somewhat skeptical of trying out the game myself, not being a fan of darker, gritty themes, but I figured since it was free and had an appealing art and story it was worth a shot. I am so very glad that I did.

This VN will definitely not be everyone's cup of tea simply because of the darker and more mature storyline that it explores. The story and somewhat uncomfortable topics are handled very well though and I never wanted to stop in the middle of a playthrough because it felt...dirty or whatever. Yes, I did find myself pulling faces at some points but it did not detach from the VN itself. At it's core Cupid uses it's story to explore the different, and sometimes darker, sides of love, the sides that we maybe don't always see or don't even know exist.

The characters are all lovely and you can see so many different sides to their personalities in the short time you go on the journey with them. There is also the very interesting character of the Mother, who is essentially the player basically talking to Rosa throughout the game. Instead of directly making any choice, you play as the voice of Rosa's beloved mother guiding her.

If you have interest in the game at all, I highly recommend giving it a chance, it is free after all. And aftering playing a while and potentially finishing one route you will know for sure whether you want to keep playing or not.

reviewText:
Holy macaroni, where do I start?
This visual novel is one of the best ones that I've ever played. All the good visual novels come from Lemma Soft forums and not even quarter of them make it on Steam. It's been a while since I've played something new. It was a unique experience. It reminded me once again why I still love visual novels. Not the Sakura Spirit kind of visual novels that keep sucking your wallet and brain cells dry, or like Seduce Me the Otome that is merely an erotic fanfic for girls that haven't hit puberty yet (I wouldn't even call it a visual novel). I'm talking about the real quality here. Cupid only sounds cute but don't be fooled by the name. Have you ever wondered if that cheesy angelic kid isn't as pure and adorable as he's portrayed? The cupid is a hunter and he's not afraid to use his bow so he could feed on your poor hearts when the time is ripe. It's true that love has different faces. It's only pure in a certain relationship (mother and son, for instance). Still amazes me how one is able to love another without asking for something in return. And then there's a dark side of the moon. There can't be love without hate. The game shows you how twisted love can be and how fragile humans are. You can be the healthiest person around and with time you start asking what is happening to you. Your own mind, your own thoughts, words and actions seem so foreign. It's easy to go insane and yet it takes time. It's hardly noticable, too.

You play the Mother, you are behind the scenes. You're just a shapeless memory, still staying with your daughter throughout her existence to keep her on the right/wrong (whatever you choose) track. The daughter doesn't question you because she believes Mother knows best.

The whole story was remarkably well written. The music is amazing and the ambience is simply fantastic. Interesting characters and awesome artwork. The artwork is rather realistic.

Really enjoyed getting all the endings and then checking out the bonus. Guilleme is such a queen! Gotta love his colorful diary.
I will definitely play Who is Mike next. Also, thanks for recommending tinytim12 I think my head is Darkness" vn. I'll check it out. Thank you for this brilliant visual novel."

reviewText:
Let me tell you one thing; Cupid is tha BOMB. This VN is great for people who love basic, but story-rich visual entertainment.

I had a go at another visual novel before trying this one, and I wasn't impressed - especially since further gameplay required paying (which Cupid does not!).

And Cupid is anything but cliché! This VN is filled with all sorts of twisted elements.

It is loaded with darkness, mystery, intensity & intrigue, yum!

The story deals with various themes such as; submission/domination, distortion/paranoia/psychosis, emotional manipulation/seduction/incest & different types of love (for better ... or worse).

The characters are laced with feelings of guilt, shame, inadequacy/unworthiness, abandonment fear & fear of intimacy, volatility, as well as obsessive & insatiable desire!

In a way it's very sick & deranged, but also very alluring & rather hot! Cupid is not your typical erotic thriller. It is bizarre & otherworldy (and quite the mind****).

This VN swings from one extreme to the other - in an instant! - like a wiiiild pendulum. Uff!

It sure as heck had me stuck to my chair, all tense and absorbed by the story (which I thought was really well delivered - bit, by bit).

Even though some parts felt a bit drab & long-winded, there was always enough suspense & batsh*t crazy content right around the corner to keep me going for sure!

It is definitely different from what I've seen so far in the VN-genre, and I consider it a definite must-have both for lovers & newbies (or if you're curious, but unsure - go ahead and try it). You might be pleasantly surprised!

I got ending number 3 (= potentially incestuous) when I finished the story (there's a total of 4 + bonus content to unlock).

I'm so grateful the developers chose to offer this VN for free - I enjoyed it so much I wouldn't mind donating or paying for (optional!) downloadable content (like artwork or soundtracks).

Which brings me to the endearing & enticing visual aspect & the eerie (but very effective) sound effects which grabbed & held my attention at the right time :)!

I found the music very touching as well. It evoked all sorts of emotions in me (which I appreciated).

Animation-wise, Cupid is pretty basic (i.e. limited expressions, but good enough!). It does the job.

I loved the addition of animated, flashing stills during gameplay. I found that very captivating & titillating. Most definitely tickled my senses & imagination (in a good way).

On a final note, I found the story interesting, with more than sufficient content delivered (i.e. characters, text & scenery).

I especially appreciated how the content was delivered in an elegant way and was in no way vulgar (i.e. both artwork & script).

I wouldn't mind more of this!

First off I gotta say that this game is FREE! Second the game is not buggy or suffer from a terrible, unreadable translation issues. Well besides that we'll cut to the chase and describe the story.

The VN takes a unique approach in that instead of controling a character you play as a voice inside the main character's head. Our main character has suffered quite a bit due to some unknown curse she has. She finds hope returning to her a party hosted by a young aristocrat in town. Little does she know what she is in for at this party.

The game revolves on the idea of a human cupid and the issues of love. This is far from a happy and bubbly love story. Be warned that it can get dark at points.

In other notes: You might not get certain achievements if you press buttons or click too quickly, so I recommend that you set the text to fast if you want the dialogue to spit out fast.

reviewText:
TL;DR: The game is dark and the player is used in an original way with lots of varied endings but the story is linear and there's not enough depth to some of the main characters.

God, I was so torn about this game and I'm truly starting to dislike the whole yes/no only system.
I finally decided on no because of the overwhelmingly positive rating the game has. To clarify: the game is not gonna suffer from this review, especially since it's free.
I really believe that this game deserves a chance from most VN fans and if you have a few hours to kill, I can easily suggest that you give it a try, your money won't be wasted, trust me! Your time, however...well, that depends.
I'll mention the issues first so we can end on a positive note.

Cons:
- The game is linear. When not considering the endings, the rest of the game has a very straight path, I would have liked a little more branching during the story line,  nothing major just that some events were a little more varied.
- Some characters are not sympathetic. You're given little reason to like them or care what happens to them, outside of some rather cliché attributes. If anything you almost cheer if someone dies. *cough*Guilleme*cough*.
- The ending is not a natural conclusion. This ties in with the linearity, there is not enough of a change throughout the story to justify the final 'snap' in the protagonist's personality one way or the other, it's just too sudden.
- The game's text/choice ratio is off. There are huge parts of nothing but reading then huge parts with a lot of choices and that throws off the balance as if they suddenly remembered, 'oh, right, the player!'.
- The endings. This is a personal gripe with 'hidden', 'true', 'secret', etc. It bugs me when an ending can only be reached if you play the game so and so many times, with no in-game reason for WHY.
- The genre. This is nitpicking, I know, but this kind of game is just not an RPG, there's too little agency. I know that technically EVERY game is an RPG but for people who assign a certain meaning to that genre, this just doesn't cut it.

Pros:
- The story. In itself it's interesting, it's dark and psychological and I wanted to know what happened next.
- The naughty bits. They are very well written and despite what some say I found that they fit in the context.
- The endings. Extremely varied and take a lot of choices into consideration and it's interesting to try out the extremes.
- Dark theme, The dark parts are well explored and the overall setting never strays from its ominous and mysterious path.
- Rosa. You do care about her plight and how hard she's trying and there is a certain feeling of 'poor girl' while playing.
- Originality. Playing mother's voice who tries to influence her daughter is a very intriguing prospect, and even though there isn't always a satisfying response, that sometimes really works in the game's favor as you find that your influence isn't as rooted as you thought.

In conclusion: The game is definitely worth the price tag and if you have an afternoon with nothing else to do, it's at the very least interesting pass time. It won't be good to everyone but if you're a VN fan, you're no worse off for giving it a try.

Wow. Well, off the bat I can say that as a writer, and avid literature enthusiast, I was curious how much depth and substance a visual novel on Steam would be. But MAN was I glad to see this VN.

I'm not going to leave an incredibly lengthy review, but I find this VN incredibly appealing. The Mature Filter is an interesting and nice touch, (I played through with it off, but it's cool that there's a toned down option just in case.) and the characters and story had a surprising amount of depth and intrigue. After the first chapter, I found myself continually invested in learning where the story and characters would go, and there were quite a few times where I found myself genuinely surprised by the paths the story went.

Even more appealing is the fact that the VN gives you several paths to take, and gives it legitimate reply value. As I have far from finished all the paths, I find myself excited to sit down and go through it again already; however it will have to wait until another day.

If you're interested in the drama, with some very dark and curious twists to the storyline and characters alike, then I'd definitely suggest downloading Cupid. It is well worth the time.

This is definitely on the list of best VNs I've ever played.  It's worlds better than some games that I've paid $30+ for and I didn't have to spend a dime on it.  Almost enough to make a person feel guilty.

Although love is the overall theme, what really sucked me in initially was the suspense and feeling of slow creeping terror.  The atmosphere is wonderful -- writing and art are not perfect but almost always great, and what more can you ask from a free game?  They work together to do an excellent job of building tone, creating a sense of gradual mounting tension, and really evoking the feeling of a whole world with a few static images.

I got ending 3 the first time through despite doing my very best to make nice decisions, and once I'd finished reading that I felt like I needed a bath, in the best possible way.  There they were, this character doing something unequivocably evil, and yet in a certain sense I couldn't even blame them for it. Product received for free\n\nI came across this game while searching for visual novels in the steam store, and since well..it was free, I decided to give it a try. First going into the game I was very confused on who I actually was or what was even going on but as the pieces came together I got further into the story. I in time found it very interesting that the role you get to play, getting to be the person who clouds the judgement and thoughts of someone else, I feel is very unique and something I don't think I've ever seen in a visual novel. I enjoyed each character and getting to see them grow and getting to learn so much unexpected things from each one and seeing them in their darkest times. I found the story to be very emotional and at times had me in tears..(probably because I chose wrong choices xD)..the story line of this story being te 1700's centered in France, it's either one you'll love or you'll hate depending if you like more modernized visual novels or older ones. I for one loved the setting and time period this game presented in and actually have been looking for visual novels of a different time period. I also must say the artwork for this game I absolutely adore, from character designs to their outfits too (I enjoyed actually getting to see the characters design change over periods of time thats another thing you dont see in most visual novels, for me it was nice seeing a character not have to wear the same thing for 10+ years xD). Though at times the art can look a tad cringey because of the such the dark..little bit wobbly looking lines outlining the character fully, and it kind of doesnt fit with the sharpened and perfected backgrounds of the game that appeared to be made with some 3d program probably but its both definitely overshadowed by the beautiful colouring in this game. I wont give anything away story-wise, but I wil say that in my first play through I have received ending 2, and it definitely makes me want to play more to choose differently to see all the the different outcomes. So, do I recommend this game? Yes. It was very enjoyable with lovely characters and a very deep and heart breaking (at times) story. Games like these make me want to make visual novels of my own, so bravo creators, this game was indeed enjoyed. :3

I was hesitant to continue playing through this VN when I first started it. However, as time went on, the story grew to be more and more intriuging. After hours of playing through and unlocking every achievement, I can honestly say that I was left in awe at the time and effort that was put into the plot, and overall story.

YOU influence the decisions that the protaginist makes, which puts a whole new perspective on things. First of all, it's not you who's affected, but your impressionable daughter, and the people around her. That alone stood out when I first looked at the trailer for the VN. Originally, I tried to make the best decisions, and tried not to verbally abuse my daughter. But as time went on, I started making harsher decisions, and everything took a serious turn.

The characters were all very well made, and the story was deep. The music was beautiful, and made the experience all the more immersive. I reccomend this VN whole-heartedly, 10/10, one of the best I've read.

Generally, this is a very good visual novel. Good enough that they could, and probably should've, put a price on it.

Pros:
-Nicely fleshed out, original story line. Your first play through will be solid and interesting. This to me is the most important part of a visual novel.  And it has a lot to offer. Nice character development, humorous dialouge, dark tone, likeable characters, situations they are not too obvious, and yes, a bit of erotica too... Its good. Just really well carved-out.
-The director's bonus material (unlocked upon completing different endings) is as amusing as the novel, and gives you an even better appreciation for the work that goes into making these things.

Neutral:
-You play the voice of Rosa's mother; the choices you pick influence her actions. Its an interesting concept. I was by no means enamored with this, but it didn't bother me either.
-Not a dating sim. A lot of VNs are about which lover you choose--this is not like that at all.

Cons:
-The art isn't anything too special. There are moments when its really lovely, but it seems kinda like the artist put all their energy into about five things, and then threw everything else together last minute.
-Replay-ablity is weak. The story line doesn't really change ever--the endings are just very based upon how much information Rosa gathers throughout the story (or fails to gather) and her attitude towards her mother (you). The games' secrets aren't that hard to gather, so in all likelyhood you will get a realitively complete ending. Every playthrough after that feels kinda dull.

I think my first playthrough was around 2.5 hours? I can't recall exactly.

Product received for free\n\nI came across this game while searching for visual novels in the steam store, and since well..it was free, I decided to give it a try. First going into the game I was very confused on who I actually was or what was even going on but as the pieces came together I got further into the story. I in time found it very interesting that the role you get to play, getting to be the person who clouds the judgement and thoughts of someone else, I feel is very unique and something I don't think I've ever seen in a visual novel. I enjoyed each character and getting to see them grow and getting to learn so much unexpected things from each one and seeing them in their darkest times. I found the story to be very emotional and at times had me in tears..(probably because I chose wrong choices xD)..the story line of this story being te 1700's centered in France, it's either one you'll love or you'll hate depending if you like more modernized visual novels or older ones. I for one loved the setting and time period this game presented in and actually have been looking for visual novels of a different time period. I also must say the artwork for this game I absolutely adore, from character designs to their outfits too (I enjoyed actually getting to see the characters design change over periods of time thats another thing you dont see in most visual novels, for me it was nice seeing a character not have to wear the same thing for 10+ years xD). Though at times the art can look a tad cringey because of the such the dark..little bit wobbly looking lines outlining the character fully, and it kind of doesnt fit with the sharpened and perfected backgrounds of the game that appeared to be made with some 3d program probably but its both definitely overshadowed by the beautiful colouring in this game. I wont give anything away story-wise, but I wil say that in my first play through I have received ending 2, and it definitely makes me want to play more to choose differently to see all the the different outcomes. So, do I recommend this game? Yes. It was very enjoyable with lovely characters and a very deep and heart breaking (at times) story. Games like these make me want to make visual novels of my own, so bravo creators, this game was indeed enjoyed. :3
